full_threads.body:
Hi Team

We've done some testing and have the following feedback/edits:


  1. The webform is marked as spam when sending the test through - see attached email. Not sure what we can do about this?

  2. Step 1 of 7 - the page loads as "14% complete" can this be fixed?





  1. Clicking yes or no to the radio button yes/no questions throughout the form pushes you back to the top of the page - can this be fixed?

  2. The date field in the last section is set in US format pls change to AU format i.e. DD/MM/YY

  3. "Please provide a precise description of your business activities:" - should be mandatory to add up to 100% - it doesn't calculate correctly.

  4. Income breakdown & areas of work should be mandatory to add up to 100% - it doesn't calculate correctly

  5. "If the answer to any of Question 7.4 is No, please provide further details:*" - pls remove this question

  6. "If you need any assistance in the meantime, please contact us at fl@oceanunderwriting.com.au or call +61 9051 0708" - AMEND to: If you need any assistance in the meantime, please contact your broker.
Thanks Joel - we will do some testing and come back with any feedback

Hi Elizabeth,

Really appreciate your patience while we got this all sorted.

Here’s the updated version of the form:
Engineers & Surveyors Proposal Form – V2

Quick rundown of what’s been updated:
  • Form fields have been updated
  • State Breakdown / Activities are now validated to 100% (screenshot below)
  • Notification email now only goes to the customer
  • Confirmation text has also been updated

Hi Elizabeth,

I hope you’re doing well.

We’re just double-checking the form to make sure everything is in order. I’ll have an update for you within the next 45–60 minutes.

Thanks for your patience,

Hi Team im just checking on this pls? This is staring to become urgent. Pls let me know and ETA or if you have any questions/need anything from us?

Thanks

Elizabeth Pace
Marketing and Communications Manager

Ocean Underwriting Pty Ltd

Level 6, 60-62 Clarence Street Sydney NSW 2000
+61 452 067 587
elizabeth.pace@oceanunderwrting.com.au
www.oceanunderwriting.com.au

Hi Elizabeth,

Happy Friday—and thanks for sending over those extra details!

We’re working on the form updates now and will send over a draft page next week so you can review everything in context.

We’ll keep you posted as things come together.

Hope you have a great weekend!

Hi Glen I need to make one amendment to the submission logic for the form pls. The form can be sent to the email address entered in at step 1 of the form. Reasoning for this is that the brokers may have their client complete the form and will want to check it before sending on to us. In summary: Submission Logic:
  • Send a copy of the completed form to: fl@oceanunderwriting.com.au - NO LONGER REQUIRED, SEND COPY TO EMAIL ADDRESS PROVIDED AT STEP 1
  • Also send to the email entered under "your contact details" (Step 1 of 7) - ONLY SEND COPY OF COMPLETED FORM TO EMAIL ENTERED AT STEP 1
  • Add this message to the post-submission screen: Thanks for your submission. A copy will be sent to the email address you provided.
If you need any assistance in the meantime, please contact us at fl@oceanunderwriting.com.au or call +61 9051 0708 Any questions pls ask Let me know if there is an ETA for this? Thanks!

action.text: Joel Maligalig assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Glen - thanks for the info here! My answers are below. Just a Few Quick Clarifications A few spots where we'd love your steer:
  • Activities / Areas of Work (Q8) Should we block submission if the total isn't exactly 100%, or just warn the user and allow it? - warn the user and allow them to proceed.
  • State Breakdown Should this also be validated to total 100%, or should each field just require a value (even if it's 0%)? Validate to total 100%
  • "Your Contact Details" Email (Step 1) Just checking-should we treat this as the primary contact for further correspondence, or is it purely for delivery of the completed form? Yes this will be the primary contact for all correspondence.
  • Visual Section Break (before construction question) Is there a specific visual treatment you'd like here-line, headline, spacing-or is a simple divider okay? - simple divider fins thanks
  • Step 7 - That Three-Part Question Your note mentioned removing this-just confirming whether the full block (reinstatement, fidelity, and partners previous business) should go, or if any part should stay? Full block to be removed pls

Hey Elizabeth,

Apologies—meant to include this in my last note but hit send a bit too soon!

Here’s the email I’d intended to send earlier, with our full list of proposed changes and a few quick clarifications we wanted to run by you before kicking off development.

Really sorry for the hiccup—just wanted to make sure we’re aligned before moving ahead!

We’ve started going through the list and just wanted to check in quickly before moving ahead with implementation.

Below is a summary of what we’re working from based on your notes, along with a few areas where we’d love a little clarification, just to make sure we’re all on the same page.

Summary of Edits We’re Working From
Removals:
  • “Single client >35% of income” question (Q10b)
  • “Are the total assets of your company greater than $5,000,000?”
  • Full block: “Do you require: a) A reinstatement of the aggregate limit of indemnity; b) Fidelity; c) Partners Previous Business” (Step 7)
  • Any question relating to fidelity coverage (e.g. hiring checks, bank reconciliations)
  • “Is one Principal, Partner or Director responsible for the implementation and communication of the program?”
  • “Download PDF Form” button (no document behind it)
Make Mandatory:
  • “Gross fees received for each of last three years” (Q9a)
  • “Activities / areas of work” field must sum to 100% (Q8)
  • State breakdown – Location/address section or new field requiring state info
Make Optional:
  • “The two following questions are ONLY to be answered if you generate income in NSW” (Step 4 of 7)
Navigation / UI:
  • Change “Previous” button to be enabled (currently greyed out)
  • Insert a visual “Section Break” before the question:
    “Are you, or any subsidiary company, involved in any actual construction, erection or fabrication?” (Step 2 of 7)
Submission Logic:
  • Send a copy of the completed form to: fl@oceanunderwriting.com.au
  • Also send to the email entered under “your contact details” (Step 1 of 7)
  • Add this message to the post-submission screen:
    Thanks for your submission – we will be in touch soon. If you need any assistance in the meantime, please contact us at fl@oceanunderwriting.com.au or call +61 9051 0708

Just a Few Quick Clarifications
A few spots where we’d love your steer:
  • Activities / Areas of Work (Q8)
    Should we block submission if the total isn’t exactly 100%, or just warn the user and allow it?
  • State Breakdown
    Should this also be validated to total 100%, or should each field just require a value (even if it’s 0%)?
  • “Your Contact Details” Email (Step 1)
    Just checking—should we treat this as the primary contact for further correspondence, or is it purely for delivery of the completed form?
  • Visual Section Break (before construction question)
    Is there a specific visual treatment you’d like here—line, headline, spacing—or is a simple divider okay?
  • Step 7 – That Three-Part Question
    Your note mentioned removing this—just confirming whether the full block (reinstatement, fidelity, and partners previous business) should go, or if any part should stay?

Thanks again, and looking forward to your thoughts!

Hi Elizabeth,

Thanks again for collating and sharing such clear feedback on the PI webform—super helpful and very much appreciated!

We’ve started going through the list and just wanted to check in quickly before moving ahead with implementation.

Below is a summary of what we’re working from based on your notes, along with a few areas where we’d love a little clarification, just to make sure we’re all on the same page.

Summary of Edits We’re Working From
Removals:
  • “Single client >35% of income” question (Q10b)
  • “Are the total assets of your company greater than $5,000,000?”
  • Full block: “Do you require: a) A reinstatement of the aggregate limit of indemnity; b) Fidelity; c) Partners Previous Business” (Step 7)
  • Any question relating to fidelity coverage (e.g. hiring checks, bank reconciliations)
  • “Is one Principal, Partner or Director responsible for the implementation and communication of the program?”
  • “Download PDF Form” button (no document behind it)
Make Mandatory:
  • “Gross fees received for each of last three years” (Q9a)
  • “Activities / areas of work” field must sum to 100% (Q8)
  • State breakdown – Location/address section or new field requiring state info
Make Optional:
  • “The two following questions are ONLY to be answered if you generate income in NSW” (Step 4 of 7)
Navigation / UI:
  • Change “Previous” button to be enabled (currently greyed out)
  • Insert a visual “Section Break” before the question:
    “Are you, or any subsidiary company, involved in any actual construction, erection or fabrication?” (Step 2 of 7)
Submission Logic:
  • Send a copy of the completed form to: fl@oceanunderwriting.com.au
  • Also send to the email entered under “your contact details” (Step 1 of 7)
  • Add this message to the post-submission screen:
    Thanks for your submission – we will be in touch soon. If you need any assistance in the meantime, please contact us at fl@oceanunderwriting.com.au or call +61 9051 0708

Just a Few Quick Clarifications
A few spots where we’d love your steer:
  • Activities / Areas of Work (Q8)
    Should we block submission if the total isn’t exactly 100%, or just warn the user and allow it?
  • State Breakdown
    Should this also be validated to total 100%, or should each field just require a value (even if it’s 0%)?
  • “Your Contact Details” Email (Step 1)
    Just checking—should we treat this as the primary contact for further correspondence, or is it purely for delivery of the completed form?
  • Visual Section Break (before construction question)
    Is there a specific visual treatment you’d like here—line, headline, spacing—or is a simple divider okay?
  • Step 7 – That Three-Part Question
    Your note mentioned removing this—just confirming whether the full block (reinstatement, fidelity, and partners previous business) should go, or if any part should stay?

full_threads.body:
Hi Elizabeth,

Thanks so much for pulling this all together, really clear and helpful!

We’ve shared your feedback with our development team, and they’ll begin working through the changes.

Here’s what we’ll be action based on your notes:
  • Removal of specific questions
  • Form logic updates
  • UI tweaks
  • Confirmation emails and updated submission screen messaging

We’ll update you once everything has been implemented and tested.

If anything else comes to mind in the meantime, just let us know, we’re always happy to help!

Hi Team

I have finally collated the feedback on the PI webform. Pls see below summary of edits needed:

Pls reach out with any questions or if anything isn't clear 😊

Action item for editing

Section / Question Number (approximately)

Remove "single client > 35% of income" question

Q10b - "What is the largest annual income earned from a single client…"

Change "Previous" button to be enabled (not greyed out)

Navigation control on multi‑step form (Step 2 of 7)

Insert a visual "Section Break" before Q? regarding construction involvement

Q "Are you, or any subsidiary company, involved in any actual construction, erection or fabrication?" (Step 2 of 7)

Make "activities / areas of work" field mandatory to sum to 100%

Q8 - "list by activity the approximate percentage of work carried out…"

Remove "Is one Principal, Partner or Director responsible for the implementation and communication of the program?"

That specific question (not in current PDF - to be dropped if present in web form)

Make turnover question mandatory

Q9a - "gross fees received for each of last three years…"

Require state breakdown

Location/address section or a new field requiring State as mandatory

Remove "Are the total assets of your company greater than $5,000,000?"

That question - drop

Remove "Do you require: a) A reinstatement of the aggregate limit of indemnity; b) Fidelity; c) Partners Previous Business"

Step 7 - That three‑part question - remove

Remove fidelity questions entirely

Step 7 - Any question relating to fidelity coverage or questions around fidelity

Remove the "Download PDF Form" Button

There is no document behind this button so pls remove

Make non mandatory "The two following questions are ONLY to be answered if you generate income in NSW"

Step 4 of 7 The two following questions are ONLY to be answered if you generate income in NSW

Make these non mandatory questions so ppl not generating $ in NSW can still proceed.

Delivery of prop form once completed - copy needs to go to: fl@oceanunderwriting.com.au; and a copy to the email address input under "your contact details" (step 1 of 7)

Add extra copy the post submission screen

"Thanks for your submission - we will be in touch soon. If you need any assistance in the meantime, please contact us fl@oceanunderwriting.com.au or call +61 9051 0708
